Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel/Nice Rooms, but off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: RADARSHE
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a pleasant staff. They are near a museum and some decent places to eat. The subway ride is short to get to old town and other tourist sites. Nice pool and workout facility. The rooms are quite spacious and very comfortable. The rooms are some of the nicest I have stayed at. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn’t have to be near a specific location in Madrid. It is a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: susrev
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last night of our 18-day tour so didn't get to give a poor rating to the tour company. This hotel hasn't been a 4* as shown on the entrance in a LONG time. Saw a review from 2008 saying it needed updating...well guess what...they still haven't. the rugs in our room were literally threadbare, completely worn down to the mat. Furniture old and banged up. Beds too firm and flat pillows. No iron There are too many hotels in Madrid to ever have to stay here. It's a shame because it's near museums. Service in bar was a problem. The bartender had a fight with another guest saying he hadn't paid when he had. Turns out it was someone else's tab. I don't think he even apologized.

Reviews.Title: “Air Conditiner”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the air conditioner is old, in the first room did not work and in the second room to noise. The service was fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mikimotto
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, in central location. Staff very pleasant. Bathroom is slighted dated though. Unfortunately did not have time to try out the spa. Bed was a bit hard but that for me was fine. Towels were sparkling white and very soft. Excellent nights sleep. Rooms well sound proofed.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: LawHyness
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a 5 star property. The service is less than pleasant and the amenities are severly lacking. THE POOL IS NOT INCLUDED in the price of the room. They wanted $25 per person per day to use the pool!!! Why would anyone book a hotel with a pool and think the pool is not included?? No help from the front desk about this. Although you get free wifi...you DON'T GET FREE INTERNET. You have to pay to use their computers to print anything including your boarding passes. The decor is very dated. We didn't get any wash cloths and only one towel. I went to the front desk to aask for more towels. The girl there rolled her eyes at me because she had to get off her cell phone to come to the front desk. Then we didn't get any towels and i had to go down again for her to ignore me. The breakfast is very nice although not worth the extra $$. There's a great place for breakfast right up the street. The breakfast staff was nice. Beds are not comfortable at all. A king size is smaller than a king size. Only one bedside table & no alarm clock. The subway is in front of the hotel which is great but the hotel itself is not downtown in the main attraction area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and good location”
Reviews.Author: angellotti86
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the door, the service we received was one of the best I have ever encounted. The breakfast in the Executive area was fantastic, as were the afternoon snacks provided. The location was also perfect for us (visiting as tourists) as the Metro was outside the front door. We had never been to Madrid before but the receptionist gave us full details of how to use the Metro, what to see and where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Marianne_A5
Reviews.Content: Tired, dated and more shabby than chic, the Occidental Miguel Angel was probably a 5 star hotel in 1993 and is clinging on to its past accolades with dwindling dignity. Clean and comfortable enough, the generous Club Miguel Angel made my long business stay more than bearable. The garden was the best bit, and a note to the Occidental Group - open up the outdoor bar and with the right marketing that beautiful little oasis could be a real money-spinner. Such a peaceful space in the middle of steamy, crazy, fabulous Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliobsas
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights here for work. The hotel is located just next to a metro station (Gregorio Marañon) and just a few meters from Paseo de la Castellana. As some other reviewers have pointed out, the rooms are very dated and, at least in my case, extremely dark. But the service is very good and the staff was quite helpful. I have not used the facilities so I cannot comment on them. If you are in Madrid for tourism, just bear in mind that this hotel is not walking-distance from the main tourist attractions. But you'll get there in 5-10 minutes by metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: 13WOW
Reviews.Content: I have stated at this hotel several times since they opened and always have been an excellent experience. I love the situation of the hotel close to La Castellana.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy D
Reviews.Content: I am amazed to read the negative comments regarding the Miguel Angel Hotel! I spent several days there in May of 2012 and found it to be an excellent hotel. The staff were professional, helpful and very friendly. The rooms and bathrooms were spotless. The breakfast buffet was tremendous and the dining facility was lovely. Yes the decor is a bit dated but that was the only negative thing I experienced. I would absolutely recommend this hotel. We had an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter T
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself spent two nights in this hotel when we had a weekend break in Madrid. Friendly, helpful staff, Good rooms and a nice restaurant where there was a good chioce for breakfast, both cooked and Continental (including Cava to have with your Orange juice or just on its own) However avoid the Tea unless you like it very weak. The Hotel is located right next to the Metro just 5 stops from the Airport and on major bus routes. Could not fault this Hotel in any way. We booked though EasyJet Holidays

Reviews.Title: “Decent quality, great service and excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Namrashah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 4 nights. We are on our honeymoon and the hotel staff was took good care to make sure our stay was comfortable. The location is excellent - close to train station and to bus stops to cOnnect to main locations on the city. Breakfast was good. Rooms- basic clean, but old. Overall it's a old hotel with great service- definitely good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Former Glory”
Reviews.Author: Santiago P
Reviews.Content: You can see that this hotel was a great one a couple of decades ago. I reserved via hotwire. Its fine for a couple of days in a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory”
Reviews.Author: Baz27
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here in March, 2012. General hotel space was amazing. Huge, very much a throwback to the 80s though all a bit faded. My room was spacious and very comfortable and the location of the hotel is really excellent. Good for the metro and financial district. Then I tried to use the so-called 'business centre'! What a joke! A few computers with very slow internet connections (my first choice machine refused to work at a speed that the human eye could notice). The only programmes available were open office, which mangled my PowerPoint presentation making it unusable. This is certainly not what we have come to expect in any class of hotel, let alone a supposed 5-star.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, faded and smelt like a forest fire”
Reviews.Author: DivinginFulham
Reviews.Content: Great location and have could have been so much more. Photos on the net are misleading as the rooms are very dated. Though deemed non smoking the two rooms we had stunk of smoke. I would suggest that post smoking ban being enforced they have not been redecorated. This is my second stay in Madrid and this is worse of the stays accommodation wise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, nice rooms and gorgeous spa”
Reviews.Author: howiet1971
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights on a weekend break. It's in a great location, the most important thing for me as it was my first time in Madrid and was sightseeing. The metro stop was literally outside the hotel door, 25 mins from the airport by metro (only 1 change and €2!!!!) and 10-15 mins from the very centre by metro. 10 minute walk to the gay area (for those who want to know). The rooms were functional, clean and 'nice' , but I was only in the rooms to sleep. Saying that, they were great rooms, just not worthy of 5 star. I only paid £100 for th ewholoe holiday on a special easyjet deal so i cannot comment on the normal value. The breakfast was amazing, sooooo many options, and the spa beautiful!!! Very modern, lovely facilities, which was perfect for a morning swim or evening soak before going back out into the city. In summary - great location, clean and functional, just not worthy of 5*

Reviews.Title: “In dire need of an uplift. Not a 5 star anymore”
Reviews.Author: EmanemBarcelona
Reviews.Content: First the downsides: Have stayed twice in this hotel, on both occasions on a business trip for a whole week and in a standard room. I will avoid staying here again, and have told my hosts to book another place for my next trip. The hotel lives on the memory of a past 5 star hotel. The décor and furniture are in dire need of being replaced, same with the carpets which look old and worn out and the hair dryer was a museum piece. The worse was the bed: not a great mattress, only one pillow offered in the 'cheap rooms' (makes it hard to watch TV as the bed headboard is molded wood) and two blankets that tangle all night long around you (and give static, they literally give off sparks). The heating was really suffocating in the corridors and rooms. Insufficient toiletries compared to other 5 star hotels I've been to. Breakfast was fairly basic for a 5 star, though they seem to leave the cheese out during the night as it was rock hard in the morning. The breakfast staff was quite grumpy, and the coffee they served was really quite bad (the problem seems to be the milk). It doesn't matter which kind of coffee you ask for (espresso, cappuccino, cortado, café con leche...) they will serve you this one from the big pot. I would suggest them buying a coffee machine urgently so they can offer quality for those in need of morning caffeine. On the positive side: Internet is free and location is good (metro is just opposite the hotel entrance and loads of bus connections) but not many restaurants around (although that makes it quieter). The Paseo de la Castellana is a main artery in the city (loads of Ministry and Embassies), so expect dense traffic. If your room is facing the main entrance, traffic noise can be a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel,with good access to metro”
Reviews.Author: Julie_HYorkshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a metro right by the front door which gives excellent access to the airport and the city centre. The hotel was clean and comfortable, but not quite 5* luxury. Furnishings are tired and dated but staff were excellent. We were able to book into our room at 11.00 am on our arrival from the airport - this was an added bonus. We were given a room overlooking the garden so the room was very quiet despite the hotel being on a busy road junction. The spa was a haven of tranquillity and very under used whilst we were there. Overall an excellent stay for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Miguel Angel, The real story.”
Reviews.Author: Allyson B
Reviews.Content: We arrived late friday night, and we left midday monday. During our stay we were treated like royalty, the staff were professional and a special thanks must go to the receptionists and the wonderful gentleman who controlled the breakfasts. We had two nights of Room Service and dined in luxury, which we paid for at time of purchase. However, the hotel, as good as it is, is situated in an area that does not have many restaurants. Therefore, be prepared to either travel by taxi, underground or sit in your room au natural and consume wonderful food supplied by Room Service. Remember, especially if you don't travel much. THE PHONE RINGING TONE IS NOT THE SAME AS UK!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: Adriano A
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in the business district of Madrid, with a Madrid metro entrance on it's doorstep. The building is quite grandiose, with lots of marble in the entrance hall, elevators and a chandelier that goes all the way up to the 7th floor. The room we stayed in, 420, overlloked the internal garden and all you would need is at your disposal. The SPA with a decent size swimming pool, jacuzzi, steam room and sauna is certainly a selling point for this property. The breakfast is excellent and the service received was second to none. The current late 70's early 80's decor is in need of a refurbishement, but none-the-less, this makes the Hotel a unique place to stay whilst in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Room decor is very dated but everything else has been excellent”
Reviews.Author: sheepygold
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are staying here on business. We started off at the Melia Princesa but this so called 5 star hotel was so bad we left and spent one night at the nearby Intercontinental in a Club room before coming here. Our room is on the club floor with access to the business lounge. The decor is 1980s and the room does need a lick of paint but it is around 600 sqare feet with a large lounge and 2 huge picture windows overlooking the garden. The room is very quiet and although the Intercontinental was a lot more luxurious and a similar size it was more noisy and had a lot less storage space.The staff here have been excellent and cannot do enough to help. The room is very clean and there are so many nice touches like turning down of the beds, chocolates on the pillow, cotton towels laid on the floor next to the bed, lots of free toileteries. The business centre is well equiped and we were able to bring guests in for a meeting without charge. A basic breakfast and food and soft drinks in the business centre are free throughout the day and there is a chef in the evening if you want to entertain but this would have to be paid for. Our business travel agent negotiated a rate of Euro 155 per night for all this which is a lot less than the Intercontinental and is in fact marginally less than the Melia Princesa which for us was a disaster. Obviously I do not know what the non club rooms are like but if you can get a club room and can live with some old decor I do not think you will be disappointed. Also my wife has been very happy with the pool and attached facilities though I have not tried them.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent services but not the best rooms”
Reviews.Author: whogirl22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good in general and the restaurants are great (both breakfast and lunch/dinner ones). The spa has free access and it offers a lot. The rooms are slightly worn out but they are spacious and the staff are all very helpful. The locatio is one of the best in madrid and there is a metro right at the door.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Business!”
Reviews.Author: Technobunny
Reviews.Content: Check-in at the Miguel Angel was fast and efficient. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout my stay. The room was clean and comfortable and, while the decor was a little dated, it was to a good standard.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: roseb59
Reviews.Content: Found the room was very tierd needs a makeover staff not the best breakfast basic not the best area if you want to walk anywhere would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Staying here ruined my holiday”
Reviews.Author: Carley W
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for our holiday to Madrid after finding a great deal for 4 nights stay at a "5 star" hotel with breakfast included. The deal sounded too good to be true and after staying at this hotel we understand why. Any optimism or enthusiasm we had before arriving at the hotel was soon displaced once we saw our room. It was shabby, outdated (the tv, hairdryer and furniture all looked like they belonged in the 70s) and not even kept clean (there were smears on tables, the curtains were dirty and there was hairs in the bath!). The only thing worse than the initial impression of the room was the view of a shabby wall out of the window. We didn't expect a fantastic view of the city, but it would have been nice to have something other to look at which didn't make you feel like you were staying in a derelict area (something we didn't expect to encounter when staying in a 5 star hotel). When we raised the issues with staff, they seemed uninterested, were unhelpful, and offered no alternative or solution. We tried to retain some optimism, hoping that the breakfast buffet would be of a better standard and quality than our room (we thought the hotel had to be 5 star for some reason!). We were disappointed again. The buffet didn't offer much choice and was minimal, and the food was often left to run out before guests had to bring it to the attention of staff for it to be replenished. The staff here were again unhelpful and gave the impression they didn't have the time for you. We felt unhappy knowing that the cost of breakfast had been included in our holiday deal after the service we received, and found it ridiculous that if it hadn't been included we would have had to pay 18 euros! Although the room and breakfast were extremely disappointing, by far the worst part of our experience was the service we received. Staff were unhelpful and uninterested at all times during our stay and didn't manage a smile once! Even if the room was bearable and breakfast edible at best, the service was awful and ruined our experience of Madrid, which is a shame since it's a beautiful city. We have stayed in 3 and 4 star hotels which have been absolutely brilliant in every aspect, and so expected the same, if not better, from a 5 star hotel. I honestly think we would have had a more enjoyable experience if we had stayed in a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Room a little shabby but attentive service”
Reviews.Author: durlaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in this hotel and found some aspects to be very good and others poor. The good : firm bed, daily housekeeping, openable windows, good amenities in bathroom, friendly and professional service, extensive selection at breakfast, lightblocking curtains, 20 metres from Metro station, its El Jardin restaurant. The not so good : very slow and intermittent internet connection, threadbare carpet, power failure caused fan in sewer not to operate=we were woken by stench from the bathroom!, very expensive minibar, iron was ineffective. Although this is not a 5 star hotel as claimed, in my experience the good outweighed the bad and I would recommend this hotel with the qualifications mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated!”
Reviews.Author: JJCChicagoSuburbs
Reviews.Content: The rooms were gross, a 2 star in the US. The carpeting was torn and dirty as were the curtains. The staff was not friendly at all to Americans. They should be happy we are helping their economy as we are in Chicago to visitors! I asked for a different room and went to a few all the same, only difference was the carpet was just worn but not ripped. They had no one to help, like a concierge..what a concept for a supposedly 4 star hotel. The location was good by a bus stop, which was great mode of transportation in Madrid. I am totally sure you can find a different hotel closer to town for the same price that is outdated. Would not recommend..oh unless you are with the airlines. The only visitors we saw for the most part, were airline employees probably getting a cheap rate.

Reviews.Title: “Just about OK but no way 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: BritishDavid
Reviews.Content: First impressions are very positive. The hotel is located right by a metro stop and is in a pleasant neighbourhood. Front desk staff are friendly and helpful - they were happy to move me to a better located room (the ones overlooking the garden/courtyard are nicer and quieter. And the breakfast is excellent - a great choice of fresh fruit, great quality meat and cheese, pastries etc - more than enough to see you through to a 3pm Madrid lunch. The gym and pool are both impressive, too - clean and well- equipped. From then on, it's downhill all the way. The rooms are quite large but shabby; the carpet in mine was literally threadbare, and the furniture was tired and cheap. No fluffy bathrobe or slippers, a 15-year old TV with 6 channels (all Spanish-only), and shower gel etc not replenished. This hotel wins my award for the most shockingly overpriced minibar I've ever seen. Fancy paying 7 Euros for a mini Toblerone, or 6 for a small beer? Room service is similarly, insanely priced. If you can get a deal on a room, and want somewhere just to sleep, you could do a lot worse, but this is effectively a 3-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Mediocre Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Harry T
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Junior suite with a connecting room. Rooms are average sized, furnitures a bit old, but everything negative about the place was more than made up by the friendly staff. Every single person at the hotel greets guests with a smile and were very helpful. The hotel is also conveniently located within 10-15 min walk of two malls. Overall, a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag; outdated rooms, but good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BethanieKay
Reviews.Content: The Miguel Angel is a mixed bag. It has some good qualities, and some poor qualities. I hate to say it, but this hotel is nowhere near the 5 star hotel it seems to advertise that it is. I'm not even sure it's a 4 star -- more like 3.5. I realize this hotel supposedly has history -- but historical furniture and decoration only has so much charm. The hotel was clean and comfortable -- but I would've been more comfortable if the room was a bit more updated. GOOD qualities: 1. Location is great, provided you do NOT want to be in the center of the old-town area of Madrid. This hotel is in "new Madrid", which is the more upscale, business-area of the city. The area is clean and safe, and busses run up and down the lovely tree-lined Paseo de la Castellana in front of the hotel. Also, the Gregorio Maranon metro station is literally steps from the front of the hotel, which was super convenient. 2. The staff were very professional and helpful, and they spoke English very well. 3. Free WiFi in the rooms was a big bonus. The internet service was a bit slow/spotty, but it was sufficient. POOR qualities: 1. This hotel is in need of a big update, especially the rooms. The entire hotel smells "old", and I had to spritz some of my body spray in my room just to make it smell less musty. The curtains were a bit old (and they were falling off of their railings), and the carpet was literally threadbare in the high-traffic areas. The bed was somewhat comfortable, but there weren't enough pillows (and no extra pillows in the closet). The closet doors sqeaked and didn't roll on their track very smoothly, the trouser press didn't work very well at all, the A/C was mediocre, and the most laughable item in the room was the hairdryer. It was one of those 1970's models with a vacuum-cleaner-type hose that blows out a miniscule amount of warm air, yet still manages to burn your hand after holding the hose for 2 minutes. Luckily, the staff downstairs loaned me a 'real' hairdryer. There was a small safe, but it was quite old -- and the TV was an older tube-version with only a few channels. All of it seems a bit ridiculous -- why would a "5 star" hotel not have REAL hairdryers mounted in every bathroom? Why would a "5 star" hotel not have flat screen TVs and new carpet? 2. There was a nice garden out back with some sort of restaurant. I did not eat there as prices listed on the menu were too high. Same thing for the breakfast buffet. I heard it was somewhere around 22EUR (seriously? for breakfast?). I elected to visit the Starbucks across the street for breakfast, or alternately, you can try the VIPS cafe down the street. 3. Prices listed on the internet were way too high, in my opinion. I got a very discounted rate, as I'm an airline employee and this is our crew hotel -- but I would not have been happy if I would've been forced to pay the regular rates they were charging on the internet. In my opinion, this hotel is not worth anything more than 90EUR a night. Additional notes: There was also a spa, which I was not interested in using, but some have told me is "nice". I can't vouch for that. Also, I chose this location because it is only 2 blocks from the Iberia Airlines office where I had a meeting. However, it would still be a good location if you wanted to do some sightseeing, as long as you understand it is NOT walking distance from the old-town/tourist area. You would need to take a bus (about a 20-25 minute ride) or the metro (about 10-15 minutes) to get to the old town/tourist area from the hotel. All in all - this hotel had the basic amenities that I needed, such as a clean room, free WiFi, and good location. However, it really is just a mid-range hotel -- so anyone staying here should not expect anything luxurious, and definitely should be careful not to pay luxury prices.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of positives”
Reviews.Author: TaxChic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of an update. Everything looks rather tired and worn, but having said this there were loads of positives: Really clean and tidy Friendly and helpful staff Comfortable beds and the rooms were quiet considering the location Great breakfast Right by the Metro station It's not really five star, but I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely weekend, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: LAURAEATCH
Reviews.Content: Read a lot of negative reports so was a little worried but if you like old traditional you will love the hotel. The staff were charming and couldn't do enough. OK the décor is dated but adds a charm.The garden is a delight and the garden restaurant was lovely.Our room was spacious and the bath and shower were always hot and powerful. We hardly saw any other residents so enjoyed a good rest.The only negative was the room had quite a lot of dust around,but as the rooms are very high this probably makes the dusting difficult. If you can get a good rate give it a go. Laura and Nigel

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable but not five star”
Reviews.Author: PerditaFall
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on business and my hosts had organised my travel. My room was on the small side and not really to my preference, so I asked the front desk if they had anything larger. I knew very well that I was not necessarily entitled to a better room, so I was impressed and happy when the staff nevertheless made a genuine effort to find a bigger room for me. None was available but I was really pleased to not be treated snobbily for my admittedly indulgent request! That night I discovered the window fittings were loose, giving the room a very strong cold draught, and the heating fan was so loud it was no help at all in getting me to sleep! In the night they gave me a spare blanket, and the next day they were really sympathetic to my lost night's sleep, and a bigger room was available immediately. The hotel is a little dated and the mattress was rather worn but it's nothing objectionable. I would consider this a good four-star hotel rather than a five-star really. Breakfast was good and extensive, the place is fairly plush, the bar very old-fashioned, and I thought the service was very nice. All my requests (ironing board, wine glasses, blanket on my cold night) were responded to promptly. A big plus is free internet which too many hotels charge stupid prices for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: TimmyHalifax
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, 2 rooms for our family. Good value at 99 euro per night through travelzoo special. Not 5 star, but very nice. Very nice buffet breakfast was part of the deal. We really liked the location as it had easy access to subway system to central areas and airport. Inexpensive little sandwich shop chain across the street for lunch, or light snack.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mel39TauntonEngland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Occidental Miguel Angel with 5 members of my family. We were a littlte apprehensive about our stay as we had read some reviews that were not too positive. We were however, very pleased with our stay. We stayed in the Club suites and enjoyed a very comfortable stay with excellent service. A special thanks to Antonio, one of the waiters, who showed us considerable thoughtful service, nothing was too much trouble! The hotel did appear a bit 'tired' and would probable benefit from a little updating but the overall impression we had was very good. Great location, great service and a super 5 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: wrldtraveler80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a definite 3 star. It is no where near a 4 or 5 star hotel. It's best quality is that it is clean. It is an aging dowager that badly needs an update. The furnishings are horrific. The desk chair in my room actually collapsed when I sat it in it. The room is badly dated and the furnishings are well worn. Don't stay here if you expect a modern, well appointed hotel. However, the staff is friendly and if you don't mind the downtrodden location, you may like the old hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Place was pretty nice.”
Reviews.Author: hillbilly60
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights and thought the hotel was pretty nice, though kinda pricy. Was next to metro station so it was convenient. There is a little grocery store around the corner so we would go buy water and snacks there. A noodle shop and a little deli are not far away. Money exchange at the deck was fair and staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Come on, it's not that bad”
Reviews.Author: Liilak
Reviews.Content: OK, so we booked this hotel since it was cheaper than many in the 4-star category, and then got scared due to all the horrific reviews we read about it here (even if the Miguel Ángel is a minor institution in the city). Once we got there, though, we managed to chill a little bit since the place just did not match all the horror stories we had read about: the Miguel Ángel is undeniably stuck in some sort of time warp, and one has the impression we are still in 1984 when walking along the hotel's corridors, but that does not mean it is not a very good option for a short stay in Madrid. Our room was spacious, clean and functional, yes the decoration was dated and a bit worn out but not dilapidated, and certainly not in a way that would make us think we had been ripped off. Breakfast is good, the location is excellent and the hotel still has a certain charm to it. Of course a 4-star category would be more realistic, but this by no means is the shabby place a lot of people complain about here. It's decently priced and its lack of renovation even gives it a certain mid-80s kind of charm! A good, middle-of-the-road option in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “The quietest rooms ever , the best location”
Reviews.Author: crewtips
Reviews.Content: Located riight on La Castellana, Miguel Angel offers what for me is a priority. Quiet, comfortable rooms where you can actually rest. All rooms have a sort of foyer so the door to your room does not open directly to the walkway. Having this "buffer" -two doors before accessingt the bedroom makes it just so quiet. Bathroom isnot the mos spacious out there but I found it to be more than adequate. Very nice actuallly. The Spa and, gym and indoor pool are new, modern. Just beautiful. Friendly front desk, elegant lobby.... granted, it is time for an upgrade of the rooms but as a whole, I loved the Miguel Angel.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for your last night in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: frysix
Reviews.Content: When you're done sight-seeing and want to shop, work out, get a spa treatment and dine "in" gourmet, this is your choice. Any "dated" aspects were not a bother; the room was plenty comfortable and quiet. The area south has the renowned shopping, and Brioche was a perfect (dinner) ending to our trip. The workout/spa facility is fantastic, but I can see why it's annoying to pay 5 euro for the required swim cap...I just chose not to swim.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Business”
Reviews.Author: ravMumbai
Reviews.Content: Well, hotel is 5-star but is definitely dated. The Linen and bathroom were absolutely clean and fresh as you would expect them to be. The rooms and restaurant need immediate renovation. Everything works well but you can see that furniture and carpets need immediate replacement. The hotel is still 10-years back from todays trend and decor. Also No free internet for guests. Come on guys, charge me a $ more in the room but give this service free! This was definitely cheaper than Intercontinental next door and wouldnt mind staying here to save a 100 bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: ah_leng
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 days/3 nights from 2-5 Sept 2010. Since this hotel was given 5-star, I was expecting something better with the price I paid. However, other than the hotel being next to one Metro station which makes it quite convinient, I have nothing else to praise for this hotel. Room was just so-so...old, dirty and you can see spider webs behing the door and under the bed. Worst of all, the service level was horrible! I travelled with my wife and my young daughter, so we had quite a few luggages. However, when we arrived by taxi, we had no one helping us to move the luggages. I've travelled to many, many hotels, that even many 3-star hotel provides conceirge services. But this hotel, even though they had a Concierge counter there (with staff!), that concierge man just look at us and didnt offered to help. All he did was just direct us to the counter! Unfortunately, this was just a start of the lousy service... The worst would be the reception counter! Firstly, they are not friendly, and was not welcoming. They are just there to process your booking and pass you the keys. When you asked them for more information (if you don't know Spanish), you would not get the answer. Plus, I had ordered something online which was supposed to be delivered to the hotel. And when the package did not arrived on time, I asked the reception to help me call the local numbers and see if there's any problem. But all they can tell me is, "Sorry, I can't do that!". And that's it! They did not even bother to suggest other solution, and all they can say is...."Sorry, we cant do that!". Basically, I really wonder how they are rated 5-star. I'll give them 3-star the most given their location. Definitely not recoomended by me! However, I do want to point out there was one particular staff named Isabel that finally attended to us on our last day there and she was very helpful and friendly. If only all their staff was the same like her.

Reviews.Title: “nice good hotel”
Reviews.Author: EitanIsrael
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice , clean and nice rooms. its directly on metro so very convinient to reach anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I wasn't paying....”
Reviews.Author: HoppyEu
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here on business, paid for by my hosts. Had I been paying, I would have chosen better value elsewhere. The Miguel Angel is right next to the metro, for easy access to airport or Madrid convention centre. From the outside it looks like a really luxurious place, but when you get inside you feel let down. Its décor was probably really upmarket in 1980, but now looks faded and needs renewing. My room was enormous - easily double the size of standard rooms elsewhere - and the bed was bigger than King size. Bathroom, by comparison, was pokey. Toiletries etc are generous. But for me, it's sleep quality that counts and this is yet another hotel that hasn't been designed with this in mind. Guests need to sleep. But in some parts of the 7th floor, for example, there is so much noise coming from the hotel's own air conditioning system (outside in the corridor, and above the ceilings) that it's impossible to sleep. I asked for, and was given, a slightly quieter room, but I just find it amazing that any decent hotel would even try to get a guest to sleep in room 701. The room had been smoked in. Breakfast was standard buffet style; good quality food. Staff (or hotel systems perhaps) were not massively competent - both in the restaurant and at check-out they didn't seem to have a trace of the fact that they had moved me to another room, which caused long delays. You can do better than this in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel a bit tired but adequate and good location”
Reviews.Author: freddielola
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute because of the volcanic ash problem getting home. The staff were pleasant and the concierge brilliant because they kept printing out stuff for us eg boarding tickets etc. for our onward journey. The room was a bit small and old fashioned and no tea making facilities. The spa I was going to use but then found that to use it I was going to be sold a swimming cap for 5 euro and in the end didn't bother. The breakfast was expensive and not very interesting and staff here poor and unfriendly. The location is excellent if you want to be not too far from the airport but within walking distance of all the main sites. We did not eat dinner at the hotel but went to a small fusion bar across the road that was very pleasant, lively and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but certainly nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MrJonty
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a weekend in March. It's nice enough and the staff are cordial (but certainly not overly friendly) but the in-room amenities are poor. The spa was quite nice but it wasn't actually free because to use it oyu had to pay 5 Euros each for a hair cap, which seems a bit OTT. As is often the case it was not possible to book a massage as it was all booked up (I suspect there is only one therapist on site). Breakfast was okay but again nothing special and the staff in the restaurant were charmless and unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “I was very pleasantly surprised after reading some of the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: blackandwhitetyke
Reviews.Content: It was only after I had booked the hotel that I thought to read the reviews (I know silly me) and I was really worried about my booking because of some of the very negative reviews given. When we arrived I was most pleasantly suprised. The hotel is typically spanish, which I like and which is why I went to Spain! It was quite ornate and decorated in mute colours. The entrance, reception etc was no smaller nor less impressive than most other hotels we have stayed in all around the world. We usually stay in a 4* or 5* hotel, so we have a lot of hotels for comparison. Our room was fine, what we expected, and the bathroom was adequate for our needs. We never intended to spend a lot of time in the hotel, as our intention in going to Madrid was to see Madrid and not a hotel room. The only criticism I have of the hotel (and I must add that all hotels are the same) is the price of the drinks in the room bar. They were astronomical and totally out of reality! We didn't use the bar or restaurant, as we preferred to eat in town. There were a number of small cafes etc around for breakfast. The real boon of this hotel was the proximity of the metro. It was so easy to travel both to the airport and town and it didn't matter if it was raining, as a short run to the metro took just a minute. So what I would say if you fancy booking this hotel is "give it a go, make your own mind up, it was not bad at all, it was clean, the staff were very helpful and friendly and it was in a very good position, just out of town without being too far"

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel with charm and elegance”
Reviews.Author: madrid8811
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived the staff in this hotel charmed and were keen to ensure that we enjoyed the luxury of this hotel. Staff were helpful and always appeared delighted to help and assist with our exploration of the city. The garden area was delightful and allows guests to enjoy the fabulous climate away from the bustle of the busy city. The bar / lounge was one of the most realxing we have visited and it was a luxury to enjoy the tasteful antiques. Breakfast, once again was of the highest standard and staff beavered to ensure that high standards were maintained. To relax one's tired feet one could not do better than to head for one of the most tranquil spas ever! Thanks to the staff of the Angel Miguel this was one fo teh most realxing city breaks we have ever enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: KahluaLondon
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel has been unfairly criticised. My son and I enjoyed a long weekend here through Airmiles and found the hotel very clean and the staff friendly and helpful. The concierge, Alberto, exceptionally so. I would agree that the rooms are probably more 4* than 5* but contain all the usual and necessary facilities with a pleasant view over the hotel garden. Clean white towels were provided each day - can't understand why anyone would feel the need to take their own towels as has been suggested. I agree that the 6pm closure of the delightful spa is a little early and we were very disappointed, after a long day hot day in Madrid, to find that the Spa is closed on a Sunday. However, the location right beside the metro is excellent and also provides easy access for the airport. Beware the expensive minibar!

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel, well located and well priced”
Reviews.Author: PhilWallace
Reviews.Content: We had trepidations about this hotel because of some of the reviews on this site, but we got a very good offer through Airmiles and decided to take a chance - glad we did! The room (419) was spacious with a well fitted bathroom. Air conditioning was very effective if a little noisy (I've never used a hotel where that wasn't the case). The room was fitted with the standard and nowadays expected personal safe - I can only assume that the person who had cash stolen failed to use the safe. Our bed linen was changed every other day. Our towels were changed every day and on one day when we showered again in the late afternoon we found that fresh towels were again in place when we got back in the evening. The staff were attentive, helpful and courteous. The buffet breakfast included in the deal was the best I've ever had - including wine, champagne, Bucks Fizz if you like! We had a wonderful stay and I can't recommend this hotel too highly. I see comments about airline staff in other reviews. One breakfast we were seated beside an American Airlines pilot who told us he used the hotel frequently and was always well looked after and had nothing but praise for the place - I'd say that's a good enough recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RBMD
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here. Hotel is located in quiet section of Madrid, a block from the Sorolla Museum (a must). Hotel is not within walking distance to many of the major attractions. It is adjacent to a Metro station, 3 stations from most tourist sites .If you like to return to your hotel frequently during the day, this will be a drawback. There is a great spa, but only open from 10-6. Breakfast as part of our room rate had excellent menu.

Reviews.Title: “No sense of service”
Reviews.Author: PBR01
Reviews.Content: Arrived 6pm Sunday to find gym, pool and sauna closed at 6pm. Nothing about the limited hours on the website, but 6 o'clock! Room with a view of a brick wall. Complained about both and got 'shrugged shoulders' from 2 English speaking members of staff. No offer of a different room, no gym/pool arrangement with other hotels. First and last time I will use Occidental. So for my night in a 5 star hotel in the capital of Spain I got a bed. Not very good. I deliberately ate elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not a True 5* and no good for tourism”
Reviews.Author: GeneGoodchild
Reviews.Content: We had a long weekend in Madrid over the Carnival 2009. The hotel is really easy to find being ust outside Gregria Marron (spelt wrong!) Metro but is in the business district which for business is great but no good for tourists like we were. From the out the reception look great but it is not until you go through the doors until you get that typical Spanish toilet/drains smell - everytime! Do not take a new client here if you wish to impress as the smell in the lobby is horrid! Reception & Conciege staff were all good and generally helpful. The room was ok if not a little tired. We chose the Deluxe rooms but I have stayed in 3-4* standard rooms that have been better. Huge downside to the rooms in no Tea & Coffee making and at 4E a pop from Room service, if they turn up, can get pricey after a few days. Not a bad hotel but I am sure there are better in Madrid for the same cost or price. We would look hard elsewhere before going back.

Reviews.Title: “excellence in service”
Reviews.Author: joselillomartine
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff really makes difference. Front desk staff is very efficient and corteous as well as the consierge, House keeping is respecfull with personal belongings. Room service (a little bit pricey) but food was delivered promtly and simply right! but the thing that really made the difference to me was the attitude of the sincere staff, from bell boys to front desk manager. It will be my house away from home in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “2 SETS OF ROOMS. I Booked through Hotel.com got a YMCA deal”
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Miguel Angel for 4 nights in the beginning of October 2008. At that time I booked the room through the hotel own reservation system. I had an overall 5+ star experience especially as far as the room cleanliness and beauty. On November 10, I needed to spend one night in Madrid on route home, because of the easy access to the metro I booked one night via Hotel.com for the total of $209. I expected the same experience as in my prior stay. I arrived to the room at 10:00pm. It started dawning on me how different the room was this time. The decor was dated and the room was very dusty . After touching anything in the room I had to wash my hands. The carpet was nothing but compounded dust. The old dust laden curtains covered a very dirty plastic shutter. After pulling a very dirty shutter belt the view from the room was an interior wall 20 feet away. The hotel hosts airline crews. On the flight home I talked to 3 flight attendants who lay over in the Miguel Angel hotel who told me that they had the same feeling of needing to wash their hands after touching surfaces in the rooms. One of them even stated she brings her own towels.I believe Hotel.com pays Occidental for the old rooms that are for the use of airline crews but charged me the price for a 5 star room. I was offered to change the room but it was 11:30 at night. It was to late for me. I did not sleep much because of discomfort from lack of cleanliness. I am told by my credit card bank that there is 30 minute period to dispute the adequacy of a room for the bank to be able to dispute the charge. I will not stay in Miguel Angel again because of their arrogance and double standard. I feel I was mislead by Hotel.com.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlie2412
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner have stayed at this hotel twice. The only thing i can agree with in the bad reviews about this hotel is the dated decor, but surely the colour of the wallpaper isnt what you went there for. The service is always good. The staff are polite and will help you however they can. The food in the resturant is pricey but no more than you would expect in a 5 star hotel. The location is excellent being right next to the metro. Our stays at the hotels have been brilliant and WE WILL BE STAYING THERE AGAIN. Some tips- Dont be afriad to use the metro it is really simple and really cheap. Visit Momabar (come out of the hotel turn left its just round the corner) its really sophisticated and trendy they serve a tapas type menu. If you do use the metro to Sol get off at Tribunal turn left out of the exit and walk the rest of the way as you will discover some brilliant shops. When you are in Sol beware of pick pockets! Enjoy your stay we did we got back today!!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkMotherbird
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler and stayed at Miguel Angel Hotel to be closer to attractions. That perhaps, is the best thing about the hotel, the location. It's convenient to the metro and within walking distance (long walk) to central attractions. However, my room was seedy; stained/worn carpeting and furniture...rather depressing. The hotel restaraunt was pricey and the fare nothing special. The lounge is dark and the furniture a bit lumpy and worn looking. Again, just this side of seedy. Breakfast was average but the price was high. The staff was somewhat friendly and sometimes helpful. I won't stay there again and won't recommend it to my business traveling colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irishkisser
Reviews.Content: This was a group visit for a 3 night stay in Madrid. We booked the hotel via airmiles website (not using any "miles") and received a good offer of 3 nights for price of two, B&B. It cost us around £140 a head and if you check out other sites or the hotel itself you will see that it was a good offer! If you use this hotel and are arriving from the airport use the Metro; we were going to get two taxis at around €30 each but on advice of Easyjet steward took the Metro. Cost €2 each and we were there in 20 minutes (although the walk in the airport did take 5-10 minutes from T1 to T2 but you don't leave the airport building). There is only one change at the end of line 8 at Nuevos Ministerios, on to line 10 and one stop to Gregorio Maranon. At the station turn left at the exit turnstyles and the hotel is at the top of the steps. The Metro system system was clean and safe. We arrived late after midnight but check in was fine if a bit slow, each room having to check in separately, but not a problem. The rooms differed in size but were adequate. The decor did appear a bit tired but rooms were clean. Despite being winter and cold outside the hotel was warm and we had to keep trying to cool the room down at night. The bathroom facilities were good with plenty shampoo and bath wash, and other complimentary items. After reading another persons comments it was strange to have "cheap" toilet paper in a 5* hotel but then I've never seen this as a selling point. Breakfast however was quite a disappointment for a 5* hotel. The restaurant was split into smoking and non-smoking but we were forced to take the former as non smoking was full; not too happy at this but the restaurant manager just shrugged rather stuffily (possibly as we were dressed in jeans ready for sightseeing whilst there were plenty business types in suits). The selection of food wasn't great. The hot food didn't look particularly appetising but probably catered for the Spanish residents which was fine, but the cold buffet wasn't particularly plentiful in supply either. There were plenty of bread rolls though and mini croissant and cakes/pastries. There was also plenty fruit and some plain yoghurt. If you take the hotel on room only basis I would advise you to eat elsewhere as I think the breakfast supplement was pricey. The public areas of the hotel were very good, large and airy but the weekend wasn't too busy in the hotel so may have had an impact. One good point regarding the housekeeping was that we showered early evening prior to going out on the Saturday. We arrived back so our bed having been turned down and the towels replaced for the morning.Was really impressed! The hotel itself is very well situated for the metro so no problems getting around. The blue line Madrid bus tour passes the hotel stopping around 5 mins away across the road. The hotel is also close to the Bernabeu Stadium if you are taking in the football. Overall this is a very good hotel, maybe pushing it for 5* rating but certainly 4+ in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: belmontdon73
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. The good points for me are that the hotel is right beside an underground station. Also, the staff have always been very friendly when i have stayed here. I find the cafe in the foyer area to be extremely comfy and a nice place to meet colleagues or simply to read the papers. Also, the hotel is relatively quiet because it is not in the heart of the city centre but it is also only 10 minutes from the city centre as it has an underground station so close. The poor points for me (for a 5 star hotel) are the decor and rooms which are a little dated. Also, the TV system is old and not really the best. Hope that helps, I've been in this place 3 or 4 times (so that tells you that i think it's pretty good) mostly because of the location and the nice ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Hotel; Not Impressive”
Reviews.Author: CNET
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel expecting to get a first class, secure, comfortable, luxurious hotel. Also, we wanted to have a pool. Little did I know that the pool hours are only from 10:00 - 6:00, which rendered it useless for us since we wanted to see the city during the day and enjoy the pool in the evening. We did sleep in one mornign so that we could utilize the pool at 10:00; however, we could not swim because a swimming cap was required in order to enter the pool. The front desk employees were neither cordial, not accommodating. I was also surprised to find a bill for $10.12 for making 10-15 minutes worth of calls to locations within Spain, when it was posted as being 0.11 / minute. The carpeting was very old and stained and immediately gave me a poor impression of the hotel. To top things off the television routinely would lose signal at critical moments during programs. Also, the channel selection was quite thin to start with. I feel that we paid solely for the hotel name and did not receive the service or environment that we had anticipated. I would recommend saving some money by choosing a 4 star hotel near Sol as an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly short of perfect”
Reviews.Author: Zilana
Reviews.Content: The Occidental Miguel Angel is not in the town centre, which really was a blessing. There is a metro station just outside the door, which meant that we could get anywhere we wanted without any effort, but could sleep in blissful silence, without the traffic noises and questionable pedestrian hordes. The spa/pool area is lovely, although one must question why there are only 3 lounge chairs when there is clearly space enough for several more. Our room was a good size and well appointed. The one complaint was the amenities. In a 5* hotel, one expects to find a box of tissues rather than a little packet with a few rough tissues. The toilet paper is also very rough and not at all what should be in a hotel of this caliber. The strangest thing is the flush - it goes on for at least 40 seconds (or at least it did in room 612), which has got to be the least ecological flushing system anywhere. The first 2 nights cost us 160 Euros p/night and included breakfast. The 3rd night cost 199 Euros and did not exclude breakfast! There is a Starbucks across the street, so no need to spend 20 Euros on a not-so-special breakfast at the hotel. We would certainly return to this hotel, but would bring our own tissues and toilet paper!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: CharlesLondon1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend. Food was very good. Room was very nice. And we both really enjoyed the spa and pool. On my next visit to Madrid, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: GermanyBarbara
Reviews.Content: We are sad to report that the Miguel Angel will not be our choice of choices when returning to Madrid. We travel to Madrid 4-5 times annually and have stayed at 3 Star Hotels that are much nicer. All in all the place is shabby and in great need of renovation. The decor is 1970's and even for european standards the rooms are small, carpet was worn-out and curtains fading. Beds were lumpy. The breakfast buffet was 27 Euros per person and a fair price if the quality of the food would have proven justifiable. We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed Madrid regardless of the place. It is convenient to the Metro which is truly the only good thing we can say for the place itself. The staff was helpful concerning directions and tours, but the staffers at the so-called spa were rude and ill mannered. We will not stay here again and advise others to look for another location additionally. We were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A solid citizen”
Reviews.Author: DavidfromHingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Miguel Angel while in Madrid in late August/early September 2006 for a wedding. There were a number of people in our party -- four rooms in all. The rooms were updated, comfortable, clean and large (for a 4 star hotel). Hotel service was excellent. Housekeeping cleaned the bedrooms in the morning while we were out and turned down beds in the evening while we were at dinner. The hotel concierges were exceptional -- providing information on Madrid and restaurants, but also helping to track down lost baggage (making numerous phone calls on our behalf). Excellent breakfast buffet. The location (less than 100 yards from a subway station) is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Faded but Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions on business; it is conveniently located for the CBD but a taxi ride to the city centre. It offers the usual facilities of a 5 star but is in desperate need of refurbishment. Rooms are a bit of a lottery and having been upgraded on one trip I was extremely disappointed at the shabby state of the room and the fact that at best I could only get a trickle of water out of any of the taps in a giant bathroom that included a sauna. It is though cheaper than many of the other so called 5 star hotels and the staff very attentive. Personally if your travelling on buisness I would pay the extra and stay at the InterContinental next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Brumscot
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at this hotel. My wife and I thought the hotel was real value for money with an excellent spa and gym area. A previous review suggest we have a non smoking room at the back of the hotel, which we did and it was worth it. The room was well decorated and very clean, none of the "stains" read about in other reviews. Room service good at reasonable prices. With the Metro station only 20 yards from the door of the hotel going out day and night could not have been easier. We intend to go back to Madrid next spring and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stains on walls in rooms”
Reviews.Author: raymayDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel on business/pleasure trip in June. Found staff at front reception slow in booking guests in. Hotel maybe 5 stars however the room, which was a junior suite needs upgrading. On first inspection the room looked lovely however after a while we noticed that all the walls were heavily stained around the air conditioning units. The bathroom was very large but some of the finishing touches, such as the chairs were definitely not of a 5 standard rate. Also there was an issue with the electrics, if I plugged in a hair dryer, this blew all the fuses in the room, including the air conditioning. On the plus side, chambermaids were thorough and room was always immaculately cleaned on our return. Nice touch in the suites with complimentary flowers, fruit and soft drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly decent hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: moshulu
Reviews.Content: Stayed one very hot July night. Room was clean and as-expected for a ***** hotel. A/C was quiet and effective. Good location next to the metro. Guy at the desk was a little snippy when I asked to change to a non-smoking room, but he did it. Good breakfast with lots of fresh fruit. Recommended. No non-Spanish newspapers available. I wasn't paying so I don't know if it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good for metro”
Reviews.Author: CPAALP
Reviews.Content: Stayed 22 April for 3 nights booked a package through Airmiles which included business class flights with BA for an excellent price. Primary reason for the visit was to watch Real Madrid FC. The opposition team were staying at our hotel which was a big plus! The concierge/staff very helpful, could get us tickets for the game but we took our chances on the touts outside the ground on the day of the game. The hotel is very convenient for the metro (right outside). Rooms spacious, however try to get one at the back as even with the windows closed the traffic outside could still be heard. Breakfast buffet included in the deal but they only serve until 11am and by 10.45 they start to clear away! Didnt go in the pool as have to purchase caps although this is not stated anywhere until you get there. The only drawback to the location was nowhere quick to grab a quick bite nearby. Ended up with room service after the football and as per usual room service meals there wasnt much of it for the price (but our legs were so weary we couldnt walk any further!). Buy a tourist metro pass for 1/3/5 days, will work out cheaper than books of tickets. Be aware that not many places in the city speak English! It took a lot of pointing at things to get what we wanted, and a lot of eating places do not translate the menu into English! Overall, a good weekend (Real Madrid won!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter21
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here in August 2004 booked with Expedia PROS: Very clean large rooms. Reasonable price for room. Nice Bathrooms Little chocolates on the bed made a nice touch Great location, very centrally located. Walking distance from malls. Right on the subway and bus route so easy accessible to all parts of Madrid. In-room safe TV with lots of channels (English as well) Nice garden terrace in the back CONS: Internet was slow and not free No breakfast included Restaurants are a bit of a walk however it's Spain so it was enjoyable. Gym was relocated during reconstruction, not very good In August a lot of places are closed due to Spanish vacations during the month, so best to go not in July or August. Great hotel for a stay in Madrid to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel - Loved Our Visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is five-star and deserves every star. We spent four nights there in September 2004. It is right off the Calles Castellana and Jose Abscal. This is a super-noisy area all day and night, so get a room on the back or in the center if you can. If you are a non-smoker, get the non-smoking fourth floor, because the regular rooms on other floors smell like smoke, trust us. The lobby and surrounding areas are large and gorgeous, with statuary, paintings, and beautiful furniture. The staff is numerous and will provide every service desired. We did not eat dinnner there, as the prices are correspondingly high. But our room charge included breakfast, which was an extensive buffet that will satisfy any taste. The room was adequate in size and had the requisite air conditioning, double-sink bathroom, double-bed, and computer connection. Our room window was located in the center of the hotel and was very quiet. We couldn't hear any of the bustle in the front of the hotel, which is located in the business district. The Gregorio Maranon Metro station is just steps from the entrance and can connect you with any place in Madrid. Buy a 10-trip ticket for 5.35 Euros to save some money. The subways are an excellent manner of travel. The trains generally are clean and ride smoothly - the stations vary with their size and location. We felt safe from 8AM to 12:30 AM. Contact Michael Brein at mbrein@aol.com for a Madrid Subway guide that we found useful. The bottom line: we would gladly stay at this hotel if we travel to Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Information”
Reviews.Author: EyeofAngkor
Reviews.Content: Visited this business hotel in central Madrid for a weekend. Much of the information we picked up about it on the web seemed to be inaccurate. On the plus side, it is very central since there is a metro outside the front door. The staff were generally friendly, attentive and willing to please. On the negative side, the health club was closed. In addition, the 2** Michelin restaurant on the premises also closes at the weekend. The rooms were a little below average for the star rating. The breakfast could also do with some improvement. All in all the hotel could do better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Business before pleasure”
Reviews.Author: PrinzRuprecht
Reviews.Content: Eminently suitable business-class hotel, clean, smart and utterly impersonal, but not an obvious choice for tourists. Attractive buffet breakfast, but you might prefer to start the day without a German go-getter bawling into his hands-free cell phone while you are nibbling your croissant. Buses 27 and 14 run from across the road to the Big Three galleries - buy a Metrobus ticket for 10 rides (5.35 Euros) from the next-door Metro station - but otherwise the hotel is not conveniently placed for old Madrid. Then again, there are a handful of small bars and restaurants in the vicinity. Incidentally, I have stayed in many five-star hotels, but never in one without a bedside cabinet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Miguel Angel and it was great. Although not right in the middle of the museum section or the other hot-spots, it was a short bus trip or metro ride to wherever wanted to go (recommend the bus to the museums). The staff was friendly and happy to help with any issue. Le Broche was a dining experience that we really enjoyed and will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Smile pls”
Reviews.Author: ThierryBC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite allright for the price but some of the people at the front desk should be sent to a charm course. Some smiles pls. Situated a bit away from the action but not a big problem. Maybe you could use the exercise.

Reviews.Title: “loved Spain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a personal guide in Madrid who was excellent. Her name Kelly O'Donnell. She spoke English and took us everywhere. The Occidental Miguel Angel was perfect in every way. Love Seville also, you must ride the AVE. Don't miss Toledo.

HotelInfo.Name: Miguel Angel Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Miguel Angel 31, 28010 Madrid, Spain
